Posts.Content: eag1954 wrote: Its been 1 year since I was given the mets diagnosis.  I've been on Halaven for that year.  Been stable since.  Didnt take steroids with chemo this past week, which helped with the confusion, but has left me extremely fatigued.  In this year with lung mets, I've been so afraid, that I consider myself afraid to live or to die.  Needless to say I've let this all get the best of me.  Its hard to admit my fear but where else would be better to get words of wisdom than the ladies on this board.  I read posts from so many positive ladies and I just want to know how do you do it?  WIll I have any less time because its organ involved rather than just bone mets?  Am I better off because I'm er/pr+?  My onco is not the most encouraging or the best at explaining where I'm at other than stable...I dont have the best support system, I just feel like I need all of you today.  Please, again, how do you do it?  I'm so tired of being afraid.  I watch my neighbors go about their life and I wish it were me.  Just so many things in my mind...I'm alive so how can I envy those that I percieve as having a better life because they dont have cancer..give me all you have, I'm welcoming all responses, even the ones that kick me in the butt and tell me to get over it already..lol Elizabeth  Elizabeth Dx 4/2011, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, 3/14 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Chemotherapy 4/24/2011 Halaven (eribulin) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 27, 2012 12:16PM eag1954 wrote: Michelle, I'm dealing with the same thing with my 9 year old Shih-Tzu.  He had a transfusion last summer and has a huge tumor in his his belly.  His gums everything have turned white so I know the anemia is back.  He's lethargic won't eat, etc.  This is the hardest thing for me.  This dog has been my companion from stage II and on to stage iv.  As much as I love him and dont want him to suffer, I dont want to let him go.  I know I have to...but its just so hard.  I've been crying all day, cant eat, anxious.  Cancer affects our lives in so many ways and I hate it with a passion.  The best revenge I can think of would be a cure...
